Author: Trans-word plus TGM
Review:
** Fukuou Shrine

Empress Hanko, the consort of Emperor Koko and the mother of Emperor Uda, is enshrined here. Since Emperor Uda opened Ninna-ji Temple, he is considered to be the guardian deity of Ninna-ji Temple.

There is a grave of Empress Hanshi who is mother to Emperor Uda. Since Emperor Uda is the one who opened Ninnaji this place is believed to offer protection to Ninnaji.

( Trans-word+ : TGM Kyoto Guide )

Author: おだ天狗
Review:
Fukuoji Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Utano Fukuojicho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

Empress Hanko, the consort of Emperor Koko and the mother of Emperor Uda, is enshrined here. Since Emperor Uda opened Ninna-ji Temple, he is considered to be the guardian deity of Ninna-ji Temple.

According to the origin, the predecessor was Fukagawa Shrine, whose name can be seen in the Engishiki, but it was destroyed by fire in the Onin War (1468). After that, in 1644, Iemitsu Tokugawa and Cloistered Imperial Prince Kakushin built a shrine, and it is said that the Empress was enshrined because the tomb of Princess Hanko was nearby, and it became Fukuoji Shrine.

It is said that the name of the shrine is derived from the fact that Queen Hanko gave birth to many princes and princesses.

Author: 白ベイ
Review:
Fukuoji Shrine is located at the northwest corner of the Fukuoji intersection.
The shrine faces an irregular intersection with heavy traffic, so be careful when taking pictures of the torii. Also, there are guards near the traffic lights to protect pedestrians, so if you try to take a picture of the torii from the opposite lane, the guards will be reflected.
There is a shrine office on the right side of the main shrine in the precincts, and it is shaped like an intercom for those who need it.

Fukuoji Shrine is the concubine of the 58th Emperor Koko and the 59th Emperor Uda [reigned from Ninna (887) 3 years to Kanpei (897) 9 years; Emperor in the Heian period. A shrine that enshrines Empress Banko, the mother of ].
Since Emperor Uda opened Ninna-ji Temple, he is considered to be the guardian deity of Ninna-ji Temple.
As a subordinate shrine, there is Okora Shrine (Matsuo Daimyojin) that enshrines Okokojin.

The 58th Emperor Koko [Reigned from February 4, 884 to August 26, 887, Emperor of the Heian period. ]

59th Emperor Uda [Reigned from Ninna (887) 3rd year to Kanpei (897) 9th year Emperor of the Heian period. He was an emperor who was the ancestor of the Uda-Genji clan represented by the later Sasaki clan. ]

Empress Banzi [Hanshi Kogo Tencho (883) 10 - Shotai (900) 3 years Imperial family of the Heian period, also known as Toingo]

Author: Toshihiko Yano
Review:
A shrine with a traffic jam in front of it, which is the origin of the name of the intersection. Since the shrine was built first, there is no sin in the shrine, but compared to the intersection, the presence is slightly less.
Although it is such a shrine, the main hall and worship hall are important cultural properties. Kyoto has an image of a treasure trove of national treasures, but there are surprisingly few buildings. surprisingly valuable.
On the other hand, it is difficult for amateurs to understand where the heavy sentences are not good enough. It is simply a dignified shrine that has been swept clean. I feel sorry for the hustle and bustle of the intersection in front of me.

Author: グルメ旅ike
Review:
The main enshrined deity is Empress Banzi.

Empress Banko is the mother of Emperor Uda.
Emperor Uda is the person who built Ninna-ji Temple.

As a guardian deity, a shrine was set up at this place at the Fukuoji intersection.

The main shrine is registered as a cultural property.

The land that protects Ninna-ji Temple, which is small but next to it.
I like this shrine that plays a big role.

There is no parking lot, so if you want to visit, go to the parking lot of Ninna-ji Temple. Bikes can be entered from the west exit. We are also doing goshuin.

Author: 宮本雄
Review:
When I asked for a goshuin, the chief priest taught me various things. The enshrined deity is Princess Hanko, the grandson of Emperor Kanmu, and is said to be the mother of Emperor Uda, who founded Ninnaji Temple.
Since there is a deep connection with Ninna-ji Temple, it is said that during the mikoshi procession of the big festival in October, a ceremony is held to visit Ninna-ji Temple and receive the offerings.
I am the empress of Emperor Koko, and I visited the tomb of Emperor Koko because it was nearby.
